prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base Square Step 1: Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Step 2: Drawing the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Drawing Lines for Loop 1 Draw a line from the point [0, 0] to the point [0.375, 0]. Draw a line from the point [0.375, 0] to the point [0.75, 0]. Draw a line from the point [0.75, 0] to the point [0.75, 0.6]. Draw a line from the point [0.75, 0.6] to the point [0.375, 0.6]. Draw a line from the point [0.375, 0.6] to the point [0.0, 0.6]. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.6] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. Step 4: Drawing Lines for Loop 2 Draw a line from the point [0.0375, 0.0375] to the point [0.375, 0.0375]. Draw a line from the point [0.375, 0.0375] to the point [0.7125, 0.0375]. Draw a line from the point [0.7125, 0.0375] to the point [0.7125, 0.5625]. Draw a line from the point [0.7125, 0.5625] to the point [0.375, 0.5625]. Draw a line from the point [0.375, 0.5625] to the point [0.0375, 0.5625]. Draw a line from the point [0.0375, 0.5625] to the point [0.0375, 0.0375]. Step 5: Scaling the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 6: Transforming the Sketch into 3D Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 7: Extruding the 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.025 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. This is a new solid body. The length and width are 0.75 units, and the height is 0.025 units. Final assembly: Create the final shape by stacking 4 instances of Part 1 on top of each other. Each instances should be translated along the Z-Axis by 0.025 units. Final shape dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.1 units</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.6]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.6],"End Point":[0.375,0.6]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.6],"End Point":[0.0,0.6]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.6],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.0375],"End Point":[0.375,0.0375]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0375],"End Point":[0.7125,0.0375]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.0375],"End Point":[0.7125,0.5625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.5625],"End Point":[0.375,0.5625]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.5625],"End Point":[0.0375,0.5625]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.5625],"End Point":[0.0375,0.0375]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.025,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.075) with no rotation. **Sketching the Base:** 1. Draw the first line from (0, 0) to (0.6, 0). 2. Draw the second line from (0.6, 0) to (0.6, 0.75). 3. Draw the third line from (0.6, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). 4. Draw the fourth line from (0, 0.75) back to (0, 0) to close the loop. The base is a 0.6 x 0.75 rectangle creating face_1 in sketch. **Extruding the Base:** Extrude the sketch along its normal by 0.0375 units, and in the opposite direction by the same distance (0.0375 units) with a 0.75 scale factor. *Part 1 Description:* A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, resulting in a height, width, and length of 0.075m, 0.75m, and 0.75m respectively. Part 2: Construction of a Sloped-Side Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system at (0.18, 0, 0.15) with no rotation. **Sketching the Base:** 1. Draw the first line from (0, 0) to (0.24, 0). 2. Draw the second line from (0.24, 0) to (0.24, 0.75). 3. Draw the third line from (0.24, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). 4. Draw the fourth line from (0, 0.75) back to (0, 0) to close the loop. This base is a 0.24 x 0.75 rectangle, creating face_1 in sketch. **Extruding the Base:** Extrude the sketch along its normal by 0.15 units, with a 0.75 scale factor. Keep the opposite direction to 0 units considering only the normal depth. *Part 2 Description:* A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background, resulting in a height, width, and length of 0.15m, 0.75m, and 0.75m respectively. Part 3: Construction of a Tapered Cylindrical Object Create a new coordinate system at (0.1875, 0.2625, 0.3) with no rotation. **Sketching the Circle:** 1. Draw a circle with a center at (0.1125, 0.1125) and a radius of 0.1125. **Extruding the Circle:** Extrude the sketch by 0.411 units in the opposite direction of the normal while maintaining the height. *Part 3 Description:* A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be a solid, three-dimensional shape. The dimensions result in a height, width, and length of 0.411m, 0.225m, and 0.225m respectively. After creating each part, combine them as described in the "operation" fields, using: - JoinFeatureOperation for adding materials - CutFeatureOperation for removing or cutting materials - NewBodyFeatureOperation for creating a new solid body</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.075]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.6,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6,0.0],"End Point":[0.6,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0375,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0375,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.18,0.0,0.15]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.24,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.24,0.0],"End Point":[0.24,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.24,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.15,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.1875,0.2625,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1125,0.1125],"Radius":0.1125}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.411,"sketch_scale":0.225,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Metal Bracket with Two Holes on the Top Edge** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top edge. This part will be constructed by creating a new coordinate system, drawing a 2D sketch, scaling the sketch, transforming the sketch into 3D, and extruding the sketch to create a 3D model. **Coordinate System** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.45] **Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. This sketch will have three faces, each with multiple loops and curves. *Face 1* Face 1 has one loop with 10 curves, consisting of 9 lines and 1 arc. *Loop 1* Loop 1 has 9 lines and 1 arc. The lines are defined as follows: Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.2062] Line 3: [0.75, 0.2062] to [0.5062, 0.2062] Line 4: [0.5062, 0.2062] to [0.5062, 0.4432] Line 5: [0.5062, 0.4432] to [0.75, 0.4432] Line 6: [0.75, 0.4432] to [0.75, 0.6495] Line 7: [0.75, 0.6495] to [0.525, 0.6495] Line 8: [0.525, 0.6495] to [0.3375, 0.375] Line 9: [0.3375, 0.375] to [0.1875, 0.375] The arc is defined as follows: Arc 1: [0.1875, 0.375] to [0.0, 0.1875] with a center at [0.0549, 0.3201] *Loop 2* Loop 2 has one circle. Circle 1: Center at [0.4875, 0.1687] with a radius of 0.0281 *Loop 3* Loop 3 has one circle. Circle 1: Center at [0.5812, 0.537] with a radius of 0.0281 **Extrusion** Extrude the sketch by 0.0375 units in the positive Z direction. The sketch scale should be set to 0.75. This will create a 3D model of the rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top edge. The height, width, and length of the bracket are 0.0375, 0.75, and 0.75 units, respectively.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, create a face and draw a loop with four straight lines. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5132] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5132], End Point [0.0, 0.5132] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5132], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with a depth of 0.0395 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. The dimensions of the prism are length: 0.75 units, width: 0.75 units, and height: 0.0395 units. **Part 2: Construct a larger rectangular prism that intersects with and adds material to the first prism.** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.4737, 0.0395. For the sketch, create a face and draw a loop with four straight lines similar to Part 1. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0395] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0395], End Point [0.0, 0.0395] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0395], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with a depth of 0.5132 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal, which will join and add material to the first prism. The dimensions of the second prism are length: 0.75 units, width: 0.75 units, and height: 0.5132 units. The result is the intersecting volume with the first prism. *Note: These instructions aim to provide guidance in a clear and concise manner for generating an accurate CAD model. The scale of the units can be adjusted according to the desired specifications.*</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. The base of the prism is a square with sides of 0.75 units, and the height of the prism is 0.0833 units. The top edge of the prism is curved, with a radius equal to the length of the sides of the square base. Sketch Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, and 0, and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). Then, draw the sketch for the base of the prism on the X-Y plane. 1. Start with the first face of the sketch, which is a square with sides of 0.75 units, aligned with the X and Y axes. 1. Create a loop (loop\\_1) on this face. 2. Add two lines to the loop: 1. The first line (line\\_1) starts at (0.1667, 0) and ends at (0.1667, 0.3333). 2. The second line (line\\_2) starts at (0.1667, 0.3333) and ends at (0.75, 0.3333). 3. Close the loop with an arc (arc\\_1) that starts at (0.75, 0.3333), has a midpoint at (0.5, 0.5), and ends at (0.1667, 0.0). 2. Create the second face of the sketch, which is a copy of the first face, rotated around the Y-axis by 180 degrees. 1. Create a loop (loop\\_1) on this face. 2. Add two lines to the loop: 1. The first line (line\\_1) starts at (0.1667, 0) and ends at (0.1667, 0.3333). 2. The second line (line\\_2) starts at (0.1667, 0.3333) and ends at (0.75, 0.3333). 3. Close the loop with an arc (arc\\_1) that starts at (0.75, 0.3333), has a midpoint at (0.5, 0.5), and ends at (0.1667, 0.0). 3. Create the third face of the sketch, which is the top surface of the prism, curved along the X-axis. 1. Create a loop (loop\\_1) on this face. 2. Add an arc (arc\\_1) to the loop that starts at (0.75, 0.3333), has a midpoint at (0.5, 0.5), and ends at (0.1667, 0.0). Extrusion Scale the sketch by the scaling factor specified in the sketch\\_scale property, which is 0.75. Then, extrude the sketch to create the 3D prism. 1. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0833, which will form the height of the prism. 2. Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0, ensuring that the extrusion is only in one direction. 3. Specify the boolean operation as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' to create a new solid body from the extrusion. The resulting prism should have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.0833 units</description>
